page.title: 04ECOLOGY AT TEVIOTHEAD
page.content: THE HILLS AT TEVIOTHEAD ARE GRASSY WITH HEATHER,BRACKEN AND SOME AFFORESTATION. BIRCH,ROWAN,HARDWOODS,SOFTWOODS GROW ALONG WITH AN ABUNDANCE OF WILD FLOWERS,ATTRACTING BUTTERFLIES. FOOTPATHS CRISS-CROSS BETWEEN COTTAGES AND VALLEYS WHILE AN OLD DROVE ROAD CONVERGES AT SOUTHDEANRIG SHIEL. IN THE DISUSED QUARRY AT BINKS INTERESTING GEOLOGICAL SPECIMENS OF SILURIAN AGE HAVE BEEN FOUND. WILD ANIMALS INCLUDE ROE-DEER , FOXES,RABBITS,HARES,MICE,MOLES. MINK ON THE RIVER AT BOWANHILL MEANS NO HENS OR DUCKS IN THE VICINITY. BIRDS INCLUDE GROUSE,KINGFISHER,HERONS, BULLFINCHES AND BARNOWLS.FISH INCLUDE SALMON,FRESH AND SEA TROUT,AND EELS. TWEED RIVER PURIFICATION BOARD KEEPS A CLOSE WATCH ON POLLUTION CAUSED BY CHEMICALS AND EFFLUENT.
